column2: Currently Residing in Mumbai                Minimum of    12-15    years experience in a similar Regional leadership level position with a successful track record of achieving results               Engineering and a full time MBA (from tier 2 or tier 3 college)                    This position is responsible for the successful Parking Operations management of Secure Parking Solutions Private Limited.                  The Prime objective of this position is to manage day to day Parking Operations and Parking management activities of Region.                 This position is responsible for the successful Parking Operations management of Secure Parking Solutions Private Limited.                  The Prime objective of this position is to manage day to day Parking Operations and Parking management activities of Region.                     Proficiency in MS office,                  Knowledge of preparing and presenting reports.                 Candidates with experience Retail or Telecom (Postpaid) industry only.                 Currently Residing in Mumbai (10 Km radius of Andheri East)                 Minimum of    12-15    years experience in a similar Regional leadership level position with a successful track record of achieving results                 ?               OPERATIONS                    Assisting AGM West in smooth running of day-to-day parking operations for the assigned region.                 Active participation in setting up new car park sites and giving support to existing car parks in the region.                 Directing Car Park Managers/Supervisors operations to ensure that all planned targets are met within agreed budgets and time frames.                 Advice and support to Car park managers/Supervisors and ground staff on all car parking operational issues.                 Support the CPMs and ground staff on all car park operational issues by the means of weekly training / meeting at the office or on site.                 Manage the handling of all customer service inquiries, complaints, incident reports and claims in an efficient and timely manner.                 Manage adherence to all financial transaction policies and procedures (cash management, permanent passes, daily cash banking etc) and respond to and implement and monitor recommendations made by internal auditor/client.                  In conjunction with AGM West analyze car park performance in terms of revenue and usage.                 Review and revise the standard operating procedures (SOPs) and agreed client service level agreements (SLA) and ensure it is followed at car park sites.                 Develop, review and revise local operating procedures (LOPs) for all upcoming and existing car parks in the assigned region.                 Maintaining strict adherence to company policy requirements including active participation in the monthly Operation meetings, conduct audits to assess potential risk at sites, management of incidents, claims settlement and conflict management.                 Handling existing clients on one-to-one basis with regards to any requirement or improvement in present car park operations by periodically meeting the clients weekly once (in station) and monthly once (out station).                  Follow up and report on site wise staffing to Human Resources and AGM West on weekly basis.                 Stay available on busy sites on weekends and public holidays and also have client interaction while doing so.                 Complete follow up on timely invoice submission of all the sites in station and out station.                 Complete follow up on the pending payments from the clients every week in station and out station.                 Prepare / arrange / organise the monthly management report of all the sites with the help of CPM/Supervisors every month before 5th day.                 Team Work                 Share seek information relevant to the progress of the ongoing assignment with Operations and other team members.                 Assist the AGM West in report generation and follow up on submitted billing invoices.                 Working on achieving required SLA benchmarks as agreed by the Client and Company.                 Share Operations activity and explore any opportunities to improve the day-to-day workings at car park sites with Operations team.                 Quality Management                 Preparation of PPT s and MMR reports for presentation to Management and other stake holders.                 Ensure proper Liaisoning and coordination with local operations team and clients for smooth functioning at sites.                 Providing information on competitor activity related to Parking operations and IT and Equipment sales.                 Client Interface                  Conducting regular interactions with clients to discuss the parking operations at site.                     Regular and strong follow-up with clients for payment follow ups.

column2: Sevens Enterprises Pvt Ltd  is looking for Executive Housekeepers / RDM  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented professional to join our team as an Executive Housekeeper or Rooms Division Manager (RDM)     The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing and managing the housekeeping department, ensuring the cleanliness and maintenance of guest rooms, and coordinating with other departments to enhance the overall guest experience     This role requires strong leadership skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to maintaining high standards of cleanliness and service       Responsibilities:       Housekeeping Operations:Oversee the daily operations of the housekeeping department, including room cleaning, laundry, and public area maintenance     Ensure compliance with established cleanliness and hygiene standards     Staff Management:Recruit, train, and supervise housekeeping staff     Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide ongoing training and development opportunities     Inventory and Supplies:Manage inventory of cleaning supplies, linens, and amenities     Coordinate with vendors to ensure timely and cost-effective procurement of housekeeping supplies     Quality Control:Conduct regular inspections of guest rooms and public areas to ensure cleanliness and adherence to quality standards     Implement corrective actions for any deficiencies identified during inspections     Guest Satisfaction:Collaborate with the front office and other departments to ensure a seamless and positive guest experience     Address guest concerns and feedback related to housekeeping services     Budget Management:Assist in the development and management of the housekeeping budget     Monitor and control expenses related to staffing, supplies, and equipment     Safety and Compliance:Enforce safety and security measures within the housekeeping department     Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations     Technology Integration:Explore and implement technology solutions to enhance housekeeping efficiency, such as housekeeping management software     Training and Development:Develop and conduct training programs for housekeeping staff to improve skills and maintain service standards     Reporting:Prepare regular reports on housekeeping performance, including key performance indicators (KPIs)     Present findings to management and provide recommendations for improvement

column2: The Development Feasibility Administrator will support the development process within the EMEA division. They will hold the details of all open projects and assist in drafting LOIs (Letter of Intent) for all new prospects within the Division, requiring a good understanding of the principles of management and franchise agreements.                      They will prepare all the internal and external information required to complete the IAC (International Approvals Committee) pack which will require liaison with internal stakeholders, existing clients and potential prospects.                      This data will form the foundation of any prospecting agreement with our clients. As part of the approvals process, they will also track the IFF payables and receivables (International Franchise Fees) and maintain the integrity of project data within the Sales Force Lightening system and therefore providing accurate information for DEAL team calls.                     Responsibilities                   They will also support Feasibility being involved in desktop research, market and competitor analysis and the due diligence and pre-qualification of opportunities , models and incoming leads against the Wyndham Hotels and Resorts criteria.                      They will liaise with key stakeholders to analyse and screen documents regarding land and sites as well as background information from clients, to establish the viability of potential sites, laying the ground work for the deal and the contractual relationship going forward.                      They will therefore maintain strong contact with EMEA Legal team, maintaining awareness of local legislation related to our franchise agreements.                                 They may also support the Development team at trade shows and will take special responsibility for the preparation of such events, including the liaison with the EMEA Marketing team and with external suppliers to prepare all company collateral including the booth itself and networking with potential prospects.                                      They will present a positive image of the organisation and embody the Company s Count on Me! service culture.                     Complexity                 This person will contribute to the growth of EMEA division by maintaining the integrity of our processes, and procedures which underpin the complex relationships with our clients.                  T             hey will also navigate the administratively complex and culturally diverse and sensitive environment across the division.                    Scope/Financial Responsibility                 This person will be involved in complex and important procedures which directly impact the company s priorities to grow rooms and achieve strong financial performance.                  Their accuracy and insight in these matters will enable projects to be delivered on time and within budget.                  They will have low level decision making responsibility when it comes to incurring costs associated with travel arrangements, supplier selection and procedural matters.                  They will need to be able to exercise judgment to select the overall best option.                    Abilities/Key Competencies/Skills               Alongside the professional competencies outlined below, the successful candidate will demonstrate the fundamentals of Wyndham s Count on Me! Service Culture to be Responsive, Respectful and Deliver a Great Experience.                      Detail orientation                         Organisation and planning                         Communication, verbal and in writing                         Flexibility                         Prioritisation and sense of urgency                         Data management                          Customer service                         Good time management skills, able to work to multiple deadlines                         Team player                         Creative problem resolution                         High energy and resilience                         Empathy                         Process orientation
column11: Career development, Due diligence, Data management, Networking, Process orientation, Time management, Competitor analysis, Finance, Hotel management, Customer service

column2: Job Description: We are seeking an experienced and passionate Hotel Manager to oversee the day-to-day operations of our heritage hotel. The ideal candidate will have a deep appreciation for historical properties, a commitment to delivering impeccable service, and the ability to lead a team to excellence. Responsibilities: Oversee all aspects of hotel operations, including front desk management, housekeeping, food and beverage services, maintenance, and guest relations. Ensure that the heritage hotel maintains its historical integrity while meeting the needs and expectations of modern travelers. Lead and motivate a diverse team of hospitality professionals, fostering a culture of excellence, teamwork, and guest satisfaction. Develop and implement strategies to enhance the guest experience, maximize revenue, and achieve operational efficiency. Collaborate with the marketing and sales team to develop promotional campaigns and packages that highlight the unique heritage and cultural offerings of the hotel. Maintain high standards of cleanliness, safety, and maintenance throughout the property, ensuring compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations. Manage budgets, financial forecasts, and expense controls to optimize profitability while delivering exceptional service and amenities. Handle guest inquiries, feedback, and complaints in a professional and timely manner, striving to exceed guest expectations and resolve issues effectively. Build and maintain positive relationships with local community members, historical societies, and preservation organizations to support the heritage hotel's mission and initiatives. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 4] years of experience in hotel management, preferably in a heritage or historic property. Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team to achieve common goals. Excellent communication and guest service skills, with a genuine passion for delivering memorable experiences to guests. Knowledge of historical preservation principles, architectural styles, and cultural heritage, with a deep appreciation for the unique charm and significance of heritage properties. Proven track record of driving revenue growth, managing expenses, and achieving operational excellence in a hospitality setting. Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and remain calm under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in hotel management software systems, Microsoft Office Suite, and other relevant computer applications.
column11: Knowledge of Industry Regulations, Customer Service, Heritage Preservation Knowledge, Financial Management, Communication, Leadership, Cultural Sensitivity, Time Management, Team Management Skills, Problem-Solving, Adaptability

column2: Position Title:  Resort Manager Job Summary:  The Resort Manager is responsible for overseeing all aspects of resort operations to ensure exceptional guest experiences and financial success. They lead a team of staff members, manage budgets, and uphold high standards of customer service and hospitality. The role requires strong leadership skills, business acumen, and a passion for creating memorable guest experiences. Responsibilities: Overall Resort Operations: Develop and implement operational policies and procedures to optimize efficiency and guest satisfaction. Oversee all departments, including front desk, housekeeping, food and beverage, recreation, and maintenance. Ensure compliance with company standards, local regulations, and industry best practices. Guest Relations: Foster a welcoming and hospitable environment for guests. Respond promptly to guest inquiries, requests, and complaints. Monitor guest feedback and implement improvements to enhance guest experiences. Staff Management and Development: Recruit, train, and supervise resort staff. Set performance goals and conduct regular performance evaluations. Provide ongoing training and development opportunities to enhance staff skills and performance. Financial Management: Develop and manage the resort budget, including revenue forecasts and expense controls. Monitor financial performance and implement strategies to maximize revenue and profitability. Analyze financial reports and identify opportunities for cost-saving measures and revenue growth. Sales and Marketing: Develop and execute sales and marketing strategies to attract guests and increase bookings. Collaborate with marketing team to promote the resort through various channels, including online platforms, social media, and local advertising. Monitor market trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities for business growth. Facility Maintenance and Upkeep: Ensure the resort facilities are well-maintained and in good working condition. Coordinate maintenance and repair activities with appropriate departments or external vendors. Implement preventive maintenance programs to prolong the lifespan of equipment and facilities. Health, Safety, and Compliance: Maintain compliance with health, safety, and sanitation standards. Conduct regular inspections to identify and address any safety hazards or compliance issues. Ensure staff members are trained on emergency procedures and protocols. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience in resort management or a similar role, preferably in the hospitality industry. Strong leadership and communication skills. Excellent customer service and interpersonal abilities. Proficiency in financial management and budgeting. Knowledge of industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements. Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.
column11: Leadership, Hotel Management, Staff Management, Sales Management, Guest Relations, Resort, Inventory Management, General Management, Reporting
